ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1 hr

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Unfortunately, this was my second semester taking the seminar (as required) and we had many of the same presenters as last year, giving the same presentations. There was a lot of repeat.
Good talks

Weekly seminar in environmental health. A good sampling of the EHS professors and phD students. Helpful for getting to know the work of the department, though gets somewhat repetitive by the end of the semester.

The speakers were inadequate this semester. It was much preferable when outside department speakers were brought and it was held in a true seminar format. We already have enough exposure to departmental research initiatives because of the small size of our department/program.

The seminar provides a good way for first year EHS students to learn about the environmental science's multiple fields and recent updates of EPH faculties. However, for second year, this semester's seminar is more like a repetitive lecture series.Last year, we had second year students presenting their summer internship/research project in the seminar. Everyone loves it as it provides a opportunity for second year students to know what their peer classmates was doing and for first year student to learn what kind of summer project could be. However, I'm quite disappointed that the students' presentation is not included in the seminar this year at all.
Great class, great speakers.
It was very interesting to have a seminar where we were able to learn about all sorts of projects going on that I probably would not have known about otherwise. Enjoyed it a lot.
There are none. This class was fine if you wanted to know what professors are doing in the department. This class was sort of a wast of time.
I enjoyed all of the various speakers that came in and presented their research material.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Yawei is always friendly and was a good leader of the seminar, and always asked interesting questions of the speakers following their presentations.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Yawei effectively facilitated the lectures.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  She is nice and very responsive to the lecture herself.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Dr. Zhang got a lot of great speakers!
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  no primary instructor

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This seminar provides a lot of insight into possible directions for post-graduate plans and career choices, as well as new and developing fields for research.
Good talks to listen to.
Weekly 1 hour lectures in environmental health issues. No work required outside of class.
Wonderful! There was a great variety of speakers and really gave us a lot to think about for future work!
this is a required seminar given on a day that already has a very high course load.
